message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of anxiety and the ECG is normal, ruling out a heart attack. Alprazolam, a benzodiazepine, can be used to treat anxiety and may help alleviate the patient’s symptoms. Nitroglycerin is used for chest pain due to angina or heart attack, but it is contraindicated in this patient as it can cause a drop in blood pressure. Buspirone and sertraline are both used to treat anxiety, but they are not the best immediate option in this patient’s acute presentation.
